title: Gamification-Integrated Mathematics Concept Exploration and Physical Activity Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics pedagogy (equations, functions, geometry, etc.) and understanding of game design elements, experience using digital tools (GeoGebra, etc.)
context.additional_context: Aims to strengthen game-based mathematics lesson design competencies for in-service teachers and educational practitioners, emphasizing real-world problem-solving skills and mathematical thinking

learning_goals: Through participatory workshops, learners design three or more game prototypes that connect learners' physical activities with mathematical concepts (e.g., equations, graphs, probability).

Within one week, learners develop a gamified lesson model structured in three phases (introduction-development-conclusion) using digital tools like Kahoot! or GeoGebra AR, achieving an average score of 4+ (5-point scale) in peer review and expert evaluation. The model must include math problem-solving processes and computational skill reinforcement.

Learners create and mutually evaluate an assessment rubric applying **child-centered design principles** and math learning criteria, incorporating elements such as problem-solving accuracy, creative approaches, and statistical analysis.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
